Reviews.Title: “SHOULD BE A NO STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jay jay M
Reviews.Content: Rooms-no sound proof,very noisy. I can even hear the sound of the bed and the lady having sex on the next room.VERY DUSTY underneath the table.Worst of all they gave two single beds put together for me and for my husband. How can we sleep together? Toilets-TERRIBLE SMELL.UNBEARABLE. Staff-can't understand/speak English. Breakfast-all the same everyday, no choices. Internet access-VERY POOR

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a base”
Reviews.Author: shedevil49
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, lovely breakfast ,uncomfortable bed .The nearest underground is Bologna but watch your belongings on the metro somebody cut right through my handbag and stole my ipod.It is only 4 euros for a day pass on the metro you can get off and on as many times as you want no good if you have walking difficulties though.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place”
Reviews.Author: Mengying H
Reviews.Content: The place, price, breakfast, attitude and services are great. Makes me love Rome more! If I return to Rome, I will choose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Valuable place.”
Reviews.Author: viky46
Reviews.Content: Well placed medim-smoll hotel.Nice and friendly staff at reception and breakfast room(mention for the 2 young girls from Moldavia and sig.Alfredo!)Good raport price/confort.Excelent breakfest buffet.24 hours free access to internet and coffe/thee in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “hotel Athena”
Reviews.Author: ginka i
Reviews.Content: The hotel is indeed terrible. I hoped the previewous comments I had read at tripadvisor, saying that the hotel is actually okay, however it wasn't! It's far from being a 3-star quality; the staff didn't know English, the rooms are hostel-like, the WC was quite a disaster - there was not decent door, neither a place to put the basic toilet stuff like shower gel, etc. To put is in one line - it's a hostel, not a hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel,great staff..easy access to Termini”
Reviews.Author: Pradeep_1012
Reviews.Content: Hotel Athena is close to the Bologna Metro Station (5 mnts walk from the hotel)....it is true value for money...the rooms were neat (I booked a quadruple room) for 4 nights and I would say the room was spacious and clean. Our sheets and towels were changed every day..our beds made by the time we returned from sight-seeing...the staff are very helpful and resourceful...The breakfast was good..u hav cakes..biscuits..tarts..bread..croissants..4 varities of jam..butter..cheese..cold meat..eggs...juice..tea/coffee..cornflakes...They do have WIFI but it works only on the 1st floor!!!! They do have a laptop which you can use to browse and skype.. Don't go by old reviews which say the bathrooms were terrible..(I was aprehensive bout checking into the hotel reading those reviews)..you have nice Gelatareias near the hotel and a good chinese restaurant...plz do carry a map of rome..else you'll have trouble getting to the hotel..if u do not speak italian..I would definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: rzg
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking this hotel i took a quick llok at the review, and, to be frank, got a little scared, but the price was so much better then all the other options i decided to take my chances-and was not sorry! Folks, this isnot the ritz or george V, and you must not excpect it tt be! This is a 3 star hotel in a major westren european city. I have been to many such hotels and this one is certainly up to par. The bedroom (single) was more then reasonable in size (there was even a small balcony), clean, the towell wwere chaned daily (even when i did not ask for it), and the room was also cleaned daily. true, the bath room was small (the only place to put the soap bar or the toilet paper was on top of the toilet;s water rservoir), and the sink was not in the bathroom but in the bedroom. Breakfast was very reasonable. Given the price I would certainly recommend it to my friends

Reviews.Title: “Don't GO there”
Reviews.Author: SergioPo
Reviews.Content: I've been there for five days, the place is simply unacceptable, I've paid more than 100 Euros per night. I've found ants walking in the toillet, walls so thin that you can hear the whole building talking, it's a kind of splitted apartment where you'll find private apartments and offices(into the hotel...) I'm not against cheap hotels if you want to save some money, but more than 100 Euros per night is far from being cheap...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: PapaTommaso
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed in this hotel while I attended an academic meetings at the nearby University of Rome and stayed afterwards for a couple of days of sightseeing. The hotel is in the university district and some of the life on the adjoining streets reflects a vibrant university atmosphere: it is only about 15-20 minutes walk from the central district from Termini and also has convenient metro stops only a few blocks away for those who want to go further afield. The hotel's furnishings are not fancy: however, the staff was unfailingly courteous and helpful; the breakfasts were plain, but filling; and the price for 8 days' accommodations were more than reasonable. I enjoyed my time at Hotel Athena and will gladly stay there again, if I ever have the opportunita to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job”
Reviews.Author: BostonBarney
Reviews.Content: Ok so I picked this hotel after about 2 hours of looking online for something not to cheap and dingy, close to the city centre in Rome and not too expensive. On arrival to termini station we got a cab to the hotel, €8 so not too bad, however the hotel is only 6/7 minutes walk from the bologna blue line metro stop (handy to get downtown/Vatican/coliseum) The taxi driver stopped as he turned around the corner of this one way street, got out of the cab and pointed at the building in front of us,'athena' he says, no more looking like a hotel than a cat looks like a dog! Anyway up we go to the door and it turns out the hotel doubles as an apartment block, we got in up to reception which is on the first floor and got a big hello from the guy behind the desk. He gave us all the info regarding breakfast times, our keys and directions to where we would get a late night feed(it was 10.30 at this stage) The room was big, a double and a single bed, perfectly made, towels and ac, TV and fridge and a decent en suite, spotlessly clean also. I cannot fault this place, if you are heading to Rome for a 3 day action packed tourist weekend to see all the sights, this place is perfect, I mean it! If you are going for a romantic 2 day getaway you may want to pick somewhere else, it's no 4/5 star in that market. The staff are friendly and very knowledgeable, they will give all the usual stuff, but then spend a few minutes explaining where and how to get to where you want to go, very helpful indeed Overall - 3 day tourist break ***** Location - **** Staff - *****

Reviews.Title: “1 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PTerry
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms. Lights that would not turn off. Trapped in malfunctioning elevator for 30min. Broken shower stall that was dangerous getting in & out. Breakfast was day old bread & salami slices. Sheets & towels were just put back wet & dirty day after day. I felt like I was being punished by the meeting organizers who put us there. We kept having to ask that the wireless internet be turned back on all the time--Sure it was free (when it was on that is).

Reviews.Title: “3 STARS??? COME'ON !!!”
Reviews.Author: benson400
Reviews.Content: Last minute shows it's a 3 stars hotel, and the banners inside the hotel shows 2 stars category. But I would hardly give it ONE star, Consider this crappy accomodation as a Hostal, not a Hotel. The people there are nice, but It's a bit ruined.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: SMDOhio
Reviews.Content: I am a person that can usually handle bad hotel stays. This hotel was just not for us. We were on our honeymoon and we had to book a room at the last minute. This was the only reasonable priced room we could find. But wow, what a mistake. Here is a list: Unpainted, cracked walls. The beds were plain awful and uncomfortable. It smelled terrible. Keep in mind, we were Rome veterans. The internet was dial-up and never worked. The breakfast was the only saving grace. Never ever stay at this hotel. The guy didn't even know how to use the supposed thing they call a phone. He didn't even know how to use it. Very very poor security as well. Just pay the extra few hundred bucks and stay somewhere else. This is only good for hostlers.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Darren26
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel offered an OK stay in a quiet part of Rome, but actually it is located under a inflight route to the airport, which means that you could face quite a lot of noise. Even though the hotel has a 2 star rating, the price of EUR120 for a double room is really excessive for the standard you are getting. The bed was really bad - it was like a disgiused and worn down camp-bed and since the hotel DOESN'T have any air-condition in all their rooms (even though they state they have), it can get really hot and sweaty during the night. By opening the balcony door you could improve that ,but then you get a lot of noise from the street below. Breakfast was also not too brilliant. The coffee tasted mud, the croissant came in a vacuum sealed plastic bag and tasted awful. Well, all in all NOT a place to recommend at all - it's worth finding another place if you'd like to get a enjoyable stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad review”
Reviews.Author: slg44
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 5 days in Rome staying at the Hotel Athena. I just wanted to refute the awful review that on this site. The hotel was clean and tidy, the rooms were small, but perfectly adequate. The staff were delightful, friendly and most helpful and were able to recommend places to eat nearby. They gave us maps and advice about buses and the Metro and which ones to use. There was plenty of choice for breakfast. Cereal, yoghurt, fruit, cheese, meat, bread, croissants and a variety of cakes and sweet pastries and a selection of drinks. We did have plumbing problems, but no nasty smells, and these were dealt with immediately and satisfactorily. The first room we had had no airconditioning but we were moved into one which did, as soon as we asked. Since our trip from the UK cost less than £220 per head including the flight, I think it would have been foolish to expect any more than we got. We just wanted a comfy bed in a quiet area to provide a base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “3 rooms in 4 nights”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The employees are great so I found myself apologizing for reporting that there were problems with the rooms I was given. The shower water did not drain and there were problems with the sewage because occasionally there would be loud gurgling in the commode and sink and then it would smell very bad in the first room. The second room did not have a heater and it was chilly and there were no extra blankets that the hotel could give me. By the third room with one night to stay I did not report but the water did not drain in the shower and there was that smell again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't believe the reviewer who said it was a rip-off stayed at the same place. Sure it wasn't the Hilton, but it didn't charge Hilton prices! My son and I stayed there April 2004 for 10 days and I can't praise the hotel enough. Breakfasts were huge - self help and relaxed. The woman in charge of the dining room, whose name I can't remember, was helpful and super efficient. Our room was clean, linen changed frequently. Yes, the shower can be a challenge but so? The reason I'm posting this more than a year after we stayed there is that a friend just asked me where we stayed and when I looked at the website for the address I saw that appalling review.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i've read the other review and it is completely not true. i stayed there with a group of 24 other people and we all loved our stay in the hotel athena (for 3 nights). the rooms had a great view over the termini next door and all the hussel and bussel of life in Rome. the rooms were cleaned everyday with the beds made and the bathrooms cleaned. the showers were different in that they were difficult to manovoure but we got used to it. this hotel was a great stay and not at all far away from everything there is to see in Rome. i loved it there!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Athena
HotelInfo.Address: Via Ercole Pasquali 3, 00161 Rome, Italy
